Lloyd's Rules of ACQUIRE is a 12 page booklet that has the original rules of the game of ACQUIRE and then Lloyd's changes highlighted in red. It also contains a Stock Price Extension Chart that helps player calculate payouts at times of mergers and at the end of the game. Lloyd's Rules are free shipping worldwide.There are a lot of grey areas in the many versions of Acquire rules. Many items are not addressed and assumptions have to be made. Because of this, I felt that first and foremost the grey areas needed to be defined. I also felt that there needed to be two major changes to the rules to help even out the distribution of money during game play. These two changes also helped to align the game more to corporate reality.The first rule change pertains to the purchase of stock. I call it the lame duck rule. I allow trading of stock when finances are gone. This change was designed to allow players with no money to be able to try to keep control in the companies that matter more. It also helps to relieve the lame duck status that is achieved when a player is out of money.The second rule change pertains to the disposition of stock at the time of a merger. I call it the dumb luck rule. I eliminated the 2-for-1 trades of stock. This rule is flawed since it doesnt address the issue of worth or the reality of a hostile takeover. An Imperial (Phoenix) with 41 tiles (worth $1,200 per share) could take out a Luxor (Sackson) with two tiles (worth $200 per share) and the player with Luxor (Sackson) stock could trade two for one. This means that a player can make $800 per trade along with possibly gaining majority in the surviving company. If the player who is holding majority in the surviving company does not have interest in the folding company, they can lose their majority out of the regular turn of play. My change in rule allows only the merge maker to acquire stock, as is the normal course of their turn. The vanquished stockholders are paid for their company and they can invest their earnings anywhere they want when it is their turn.Thousands of players around the world have enhanced their ACQUIRE experience with Lloyd's Rules of ACQUIRE. They offer a nice variant to the traditional 3M Company rules.

Comments: To see other titles that I have for sale (and perhaps mitigate shipping costs) enter the following into your browser: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/Paladin82Y . Note that I am not a store but just a gamer like you (although one that lost his mind and purchased waaaay too many games over the last 30 years). I have tried to accurately describe my offerings from a gamer's perspective. If you are a collector or re-seller and need more details, just let me know.In general, I'm mindful about the condition of my games while playing, but I am not a collector... I often discard advertisements and inserts (so please assume that if an insert was originally included in the box that it is gone - if an insert is important to you, please ask about it).  Furthermore, most played games (with cards) were sleeved during play... but unless specifically and explicitly noted otherwise, any sleeves will have been removed before the game was offered for sale.Condition Notes: Smoke-free home.  No longer in shrink but unpunched/unused/unplayed.  Still in original styrofoam packaging inside the box.  Box shows some shelfwear which includes whitening on edges and corners.  Box has some discoloration (some of which might be from a price tag that was previously affixed?).Edition Notes: English.Shipping Notes:Note that this item is difficult (aka more expensive than normal) to ship because it is unusually heavy or unusually large or both.I am willing to meet you at one of the many local Game Nights close to Waukee, IA (see https://www.boardgamegeek.com/guild/1365) to make the exchange in person which would reduce your shipping cost to $0.00.  Otherwise--Yes, I will gladly combine orders to reduce your per-item shipping costs. (To see other items to add to your order see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/Paladin82Y).When placing an order, please provide a contact phone number--this is ONLY in case there are shipping issues--I am NOT planning to call you. Also, please provide a direct/external (non-BGG) email address.Finally, if at all possible, please provide a business (rather than a residential) shipping address and let me know that the address you are providing is a business address (this may expedite delivery).Payment Notes:**Note that the listed offered price includes a small discount for a cash (cash, money order, Amazon Gift Card, western union) payment.  I cannot include the discount for payments made via Paypal.[i]US buyers:[/i]When placing the order, let me know if you would like to purchase the optional insurance offered by the shipping company. I cannot remember ever having any material problems, but theoretically there is some risk. If the receiver (you) does NOT request (and does NOT pay extra for) insurance (decision is totally up to you) then the receiver (you) agrees to assume responsibility for lost or damaged packages. I know that this paragraph sounds scary, but my lawyer makes me include this -- again, this is probably a non-issue -- I have never had a package that I shipped go missing and think that I have had two people mention extremely minor blemishes incurred during shipping in the last 600 BGG items that I have shipped.See the [i]Info from Seller[/i] Section below for more critically important details on payment options. [i]non-US buyers:[/i]See the [i]Info from Seller[/i] Section below for more critically important details on shipping and payment options.

I print both FDM and Resin, each has it's own place depending on your preferences.  Less visible layer lines is resin and more colors is FDM.  FDM can be printed with fine layer lines but it takes much longer to print.  Resin should be completely painted while FDM can be used single color and painted at your leisure.  I like FDM frames with Resin Hex in it.

A fun board game the whole family can playBoth adults and kids (10 and above) alike can join in on the funHelps improve strategy and decision making skillsPlayers spread their civilization across a modular hex-boardDescriptionIntroduce a clever and strategic board game to those family game nights. The idea is for gamers to collect resources before their opponents do. Build roads by collecting and using resource cards to expand into other new settlements. Players and opponents should look to trade & barter when it comes to Catan. Collect development cards and be sure to pick the perfect strategy that suits you best to ultimately have your small island town grow into a flourishing city. Call yourself a seafarer by building ships and setting sail to conquer. With each dice roll and 19 hex tiles, you're one step closer to establishing your empire. Trade, build and you may be the first player to reach 10 victory points and thus win the game.All Board Games are brand new, factory sealed. Please DM To inquire about specific board games at discounted prices.

I have tried to accurately describe my offerings from a gamer's perspective. If you are a collector or re-seller and need more details, just let me know.In general, I'm mindful about the condition of my games while playing, but I am not a rabid preservationist... I often discard advertisements and inserts (so please assume that if an insert was originally included in the box that it is gone - if an insert is important to you, please ask about it).  Furthermore, most played games (with cards) were sleeved during play... but unless specifically and explicitly noted otherwise, any sleeves will have been removed before the game was offered for sale.Condition Notes: Smoke-free home.  Pet-free home.  COVID-free home.Still in shrinkwrap.Edition Notes: English.Shipping Notes:You are welcome to reduce the shipping costs to $0.00 by picking up the item in Waukee.  Although it is more rare now, I do sometimes attend one of the many local Game Nights close to Waukee, IA (see https://www.boardgamegeek.com/guild/1365) and it might be possible to meet there.  Otherwise--Yes, I will gladly combine orders to reduce your per-item shipping costs. (To find other items to add to your order see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/Paladin82Y).When placing an order, please provide a contact phone number--this is ONLY in case there are shipping issues--I am NOT planning to call you. Ein spannungsgeladenes Zockerspiel fr die ganze Familie.Can't Stop! macht seinem Namen alle Ehre. Wer mit diesem vor Spannung knisternden Wrfelspiel einmal angefangen hat, kann nicht mehr aufhren! Immer wieder greift man zu den Wrfeln, immer wieder riskiert man, das gerade Erreichte mit einem einzigen Wurf zu verlieren.Doch der Sieg liegt so nah! Ein Wurf geht bestimmt noch. Und vielleicht noch einer ? und ?!? Cant Stop!, das ist Kribbeln im Bauch und feuchte Hnde. Cant' Stop is a "press your luck game" with 3 simple steps:1 - Roll the 4 dice to make pairs.2 - Advance your markers up the number columns according to your rolls.3 - Be the first to make it to the top of 3 columns and you win!Players can keep rolling dice as long as they can advance a marker.If they can't, they lose all of their progress made on that turn!Everyone likes to keep rolling again and again.They can't stop! Can you?

Note that I am not a store but just a gamer like you (although one that lost his mind and purchased waaaay too many games over the last 30 years). I have tried to accurately describe my offerings from a gamer's perspective. If you are a collector or re-seller and need more details, just let me know.In general, I'm mindful about the condition of my games while playing, but I am not a collector... I often discard advertisements and inserts (so please assume that if an insert was originally included in the box that it is gone - if an insert is important to you, please ask about it).  Furthermore, most played games (with cards) were sleeved during play... but unless specifically and explicitly noted otherwise, any sleeves will have been removed before the game was offered for sale.Condition Notes: Smoke-free home. Otherwise--Yes, I will gladly combine orders to reduce your per-item shipping costs. (To see other items to add to your order see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/Paladin82Y).When placing an order, please provide a contact phone number--this is ONLY in case there are shipping issues--I am NOT planning to call you. I cannot include the discount for payments made via Paypal.[i]US buyers:[/i]When placing the order, let me know if you would like to purchase the optional insurance offered by the shipping company. Comments: To see other titles that I have for sale (and perhaps mitigate shipping costs) enter the following into your browser: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/Paladin82Y . Note that I am not a store but just a gamer like you (although one that lost his mind and purchased waaaay too many games over the last 30 years). I have tried to accurately describe my offerings from a gamer's perspective. If you are a collector or re-seller and need more details, just let me know.In general, I'm mindful about the condition of my games while playing, but I am not a collector... I often discard advertisements and inserts (so please assume that if an insert was originally included in the box that it is gone - if an insert is important to you, please ask about it).  Furthermore, most played games (with cards) were sleeved during play... but unless specifically and explicitly noted otherwise, any sleeves will have been removed before the game was offered for sale.Condition Notes: Smoke-free home.  Played a bunch over many years.  Overall, the game is in average shape and about what you would expect for a game with this many years under its belt.  The rules look like they have been thoroughly read and re-read.   Box shows significant wear and some minor tearing.  Box has been taped, but is still sound.  Box has some discoloration (some of which might be from a price tag that was previously affixed?).  The stickers are starting to peel off of the board - nothing a little glue couldn't fix - and the cardboard box insert is beat up a bit.  The actual game components are complete and in excellent shape.   Edition Notes: English.Shipping Notes:Note that this item is difficult (aka more expensive than normal) to ship because it is unusually heavy or unusually large or both.I am willing to meet you at one of the many local Game Nights close to Waukee, IA (see https://www.boardgamegeek.com/guild/1365) to make the exchange in person which would reduce your shipping cost to $0.00.  Otherwise--Yes, I will gladly combine orders to reduce your per-item shipping costs. (To see other items to add to your order see http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/Paladin82Y).When placing an order, please provide a contact phone number--this is ONLY in case there are shipping issues--I am NOT planning to call you. Very good conditionThe Lord of the Rings is a co-operative game in which the object is to destroy the Ring while surviving the corrupting influence of Sauron. Each player plays one of the Hobbits in the fellowship, each of which has a unique power.Over the course of the game, you make your way across four conflict game boards, representing some of the most memorable conflicts from the entire trilogy: Moria, Helm's Deep, Shelob's Lair, and Mordor. Each conflict board tests your small Fellowship to the utmost as you must play your quest cards to advance along multiple tracks. These tracks represent fighting, hiding, traveling, and friendship, and by playing quest cards from your hand with matching symbols, you can keep moving forward and push closer to victory.The master game board indicates both the physical progress of the fellowship across Middle Earth and the corrupting influence of Sauron on the hobbits. If you're able to slip past your foes, you can hope to escape with minimal corruption, healing your hurts at safe havens along your path, such as the forest kingdom of Lothlrien. By playing your cards right and advancing quickly, you can collect powerful runes, unlock legendary cards to aid your journey, or find life tokens to help stave off corruption  not to mention advancing quickly through the conflicts. As you travel, the One Ring can be a crucial tool in your journey, allowing you to hide from sight, but repeated use will draw the attention of Sauron and corrupt the heart of the Ring-bearer.Your journey leads you deeper into the darkness with each passing conflict, and safe havens become few and far between. You must carefully watch the corruption track because if the Sauron miniature ever meets a Hobbit, that player is eliminated  and if the Ring-bearer is eliminated, all players lose as Sauron reclaims the power of the One Ring. To win, throw the One Ring into the volcanic fires of Mount Doom.

Also, if you would like tracking information, also provide a direct/external (non-BGG) email address.Finally, if at all possible, please provide a business (rather than a residential) address and let me know that the address you are providing is a business address (this will expedite delivery).Payment Notes:US buyers:Preferred method of payment for all transactions is for me to receive a USPS money order from you (safest possible $$ transfer).A good alternative is for me to receive an Amazon gift certificate from you (see https://www.amazon.com/gp/gc/order-email?ie=UTF8&ref_=gc_lp_4ways_email_white -- fast -- easy -- no extra charge to you or me).Western Union transfer is also acceptable.If you (the receiver) elects to not pay extra for insurance (totally up to the receiver) then the receiver agrees to assume responsibility for lost or damaged packages (I cannot remember ever having a problem, but the risk is there).Non-US buyers:Gift certificate from Amazon (see https://www.amazon.com/gp/gc/order-email?ie=UTF8&ref_=gc_lp_4ways_email_white) and Western Union wire transfer (see www.westernunion.com) are the only acceptable form of payment. Must be in US dollars and you pay any fees.Non-US buyers--Please also note that the shipping charge will be outrageously high. Probably high enough that it does not make sense to purchase this item from me. I have no control over this.Insurance will also be REQUIRED (at receiver's expense) for shipments to non-US addresses. Receivers outside the US must also agree to assume ALL responsibility for taxes, tariffs, customs duties, etc. If these terms are not acceptable, please do not order from me.**Note that the offered price is the discounted price for a cash (cash, money order, Amazon Gift Card, western union) payment.

We shall contact you personally by email after you have placed your order to present you with delivery options and to quote the final price for delivery costs.4. Payment optionsWe currently offer the following three payment options: direct debit from your bank account (only within Germany), bank transfer (prepayment) and PayPal. Once you have placed three orders, we also offer you the option to pay by invoice. Such privileges can, however, be withdrawn should we encounter repeated delays in settling invoices.5. Cancellations, Refunds & ReturnsShould you wish to cancel your order, you can do so by notifying us by fax, email, letter or by simply returning your product(s) to Gamers HQ. No questions asked. Please note that such a cancellation has to be done within two weeks after having received your ordered product(s). Should you have already paid for your order, we shall refund those costs to you as soon as we have received your cancellation notification.Please ensure that any products returned are in good condition. If you check the products in a manner that you will have done, for example, in a shop, this is fine. Any other handling of the product(s) might entitle Gamers HQ to some compensation from you, which might in rare cases amount to the original sum paid for the product(s). So should you feel that you might cancel your order by returning the products, please limit your inspection of the products to optical checks and do not use them on a regular basis.If you return your order within two weeks in the above manner, we shall refund you the costs for sending the product(s) back to us (unless your cancelled order amounts less than 20 euros, in which case you as the customer will bear the cost of return postage). Please ensure that you use appropriate packing material when sending back the product(s)  preferably using the original wrapping.Please note that German law, following the EU directive 97/7/EG of 20 May 1997, specifies that the right to return items and receive a full refund is not applicable to the purchase of newspapers, magazines or journals (312d BGB) as well as the purchase of audio- or video-recordings and software once you have broken the seal of the package.Should we accidently send you the wrong products, please return them to us and we shall refund you the return postage immediately. Any cancellation of an order has to be done in writing (by post, fax or email).6. OwnershipPlease note that ordered products remain our property until you have fully paid for them.7. Personal dataWe are committed to protecting your personal information and will keep the information you entrust to us safely and securely.We may collect information from you to monitor website visitor patterns, so that we can improve our website. We also collect information from you to handle orders, deliver products and services, process payments, communicate with you about orders, products and services, update our records and generally maintain your customer profile with us. However, we shall never sell or share your personal information with third parties.Our customer data  in so far as required to provide the above services and within the limits defined by the data protection laws of Germany (paragraph 26 BDSG)  is saved and handled on a separate, network-independent computer.8. Other mattersWe reserve the right to reject orders without any explanation. Also please note that you as a customer cannot assert a claim against Gamers HQ if, for whatever reason, we are unable to source the item(s) you have ordered.
